intro: Arctotis virgata, commonly known as the silverleaf arctotis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its drought tolerance. Arctotis virgata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
